Articles.Content: Soooo I don\'t know if you saw my post on the other forum, but these addons aren\'t working for me. It when I got to use the part in the game it says that this part type isn\'t available in this version of KSP. I have a feeling I didn\'t put the source files in the right place but I can\'t be sure. Help me with this and I shall give you a shiney strawpenny.
I is having problems too \*sad face.
tried reloading everything, and now MKZ Batterypack is stopping the game from loading... Ultra sad face.

If you have Zoxygene installed, is it version 0.6 (EPS compatible), or the previous version 0.5? 

I don\'t have 0.6, i think it is not compatible with Electric Energy plugin.

(btw you don\'t need to install the source files)

I have no idea about compatibility to the new version of ZO2.

Are you using the new config for Maraz\' parts from the first post?

So with much fileswitching tweaking and tests, I can now use the part. Sadly, now it does not work. Neither does the ion engine that came with the pack. They just don\'t fire when activated. Is there a specific kind of battery or fuel I need? I\'m stumped.

Well, you need batteries that use this plugin, but that\'s probably not the problem.

Copied the resources folder?

Edit: Looks like you did (dynasat thread).

By the way, I got BCed is now also working as a coder on this.
I was missing a resource, but once installed, it didn\'t change anything. I tried loading the MRZ parts again, but they\'re still giving me trouble.
Does it work in 0.16? Or it needs to be recompilled because of the new MechJeb?Has anybody tried yet? (I\'m still fighting the patcher)

> 
> Does it work in 0.16? Or it needs to be recompilled because of the new MechJeb?Has anybody tried yet? (I\'m still fighting the patcher)

Well alchemist ZO2 is broken as of the latest patch. It crashes the game, so I have been unable to test any of my electric designs. Slightly unrelated I know.
ZO2 crew interactions should have been broken. The question is what did survive the update.

Dynavolt solar panels work (SolarPanels\_adv\_PowerTech) but the battery (ModuleKrBattery) does not.

MuMechVariableEngine and SolarPanels\_PowerTech\_MuMech seem to work but the solar panels don\'t animate (are already deployed in VAB), although they do generate energy.

It should work with the latest MuMechLib, however, I didn\'t test myself \'cause my patcher didn\'t work until yesterday evening, I asked someone from the IRC instead. The MuMech link from the first post should give you the .16 version.
For the record: on my end ion engines, battery and dynavolt solar panels (required cfg editing) are fully functional (non-EPS).
why is it that when i put this in the ion engine and the zo2 filter say that i cant use them in this version of ksp?

1) MuMechLib installed (Version 1.9)?

2) air filters don\'t work anymore in the new ZO2 version, which doesn\'t work anymore too. 

Updated the parts and configs .zip file, however, nothing really changed, the old ones are fine too.
were can i find version 19

> 
> [MuMechLib (required, save in plugins folder)](http://svn.mumech.com/KSP/trunk/Releases/MuMechLib.dll)

This sentence in the first post ;P
ya and when i open that i just get some page you crap come up on the browser not a download
right-click, save as, then plugins folder.
right i feel like an idot
I\'ve downloaded the plugin, but confused as to where to put the Kreuzung.cfg and source .cs files. Any help?
Sources are not necessary, the .cfg belongs to the resources folder.

Little update. 1.4 will be released next week.

Changes:

- Batteries can now show indicators
- MuMechLib is no longer required
- Part module for reactors, generators, etc (not complete but will be finished)

There are no new parts, but we'll work on that. Maybe I'll bring the old reactor back then ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Little update. 1.4 will be released next week.
> Changes:
> 
> 
> 
> - Batteries can now show indicators
> - MuMechLib is no longer required
> - Part module for reactors, generators, etc (not complete but will be finished)
> 
> 
>

> There are no new parts, but we'll work on that. Maybe I'll bring the old reactor back then ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Very Very Very Good
